item.title: Land drain adjacent to no. 5 hathorn road, 13th November
item.description:
Since heavy rain over a month ago - balance pond almost at road level(ducks enjoyed) now gone down this week but second part is still high level and smells stagnent - no cutting back been done for months full of debris / trees - no 19 for sale - buyer pulled out week before exchnage as fear of flooding
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11, Hathorn Road, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No visibility to cycle and pedestrian path to come onto the road, 13th November
item.description:
When you come out of Landsdown place all along that road there are exits on to the main road. To get onto the main road you have to cross straight onto the cycle/pedestrian paths. When you are coming out of these exits with a car you have nudge out slowly to get visibility onto the path to see if any cyclists or pedestrians are coming to then get a clear run to get onto the main road. There are bushes that block your way and then when you nudge forward your car is already sticking out onto the footpath/cycle path so if anyone is coming you would have already cut their way. This happened yesterday when a cyclist hit straight into my right wing as soon as i crossed onto the pathway. There is no way you can see onto the path who is coming unless the nose of the car sticks out to get a clear vision of the path. This is so dangerous as anyone can get hit of no fault of the driver or pedestrian/cyclists. There needs to be either mirrors that clearly show the pathway for the driver to see it is clear to pull out onto the pathway/road or cut the bushes down completely to allow visibility onto the pathway for the driver and the pedestrian/cyclist to see who is coming. This is urgent as this is affecting all drivers every day coming out of these exits to get onto the main road. Cyclist and pedestrians are at major risk of being seriously injured or even death. I was lucky that the cyclist that hit my car was okay.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lansdown Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface
